bibl.note: This document is a letter dated August 19, 1836 to Mr. Grantham and Mr. Welcker from James R. Hobbs and company regarding four cotton gins purchased but not yet paid for. Mr. Hobbs asks that they please send payment for the cotton gins.

div1.p: The present is to say that we wish to know what disposition you made with the four cotton gins we sent you last December. your Recpt. calls for 3 @ 200$ and one at 125$
We should be obliged if you write us on Recpt. of this whether you have sold any of the above gins as yet and whether we can receive any of the money for them this ensuing fall
